article.title: Plastid osmotic stress influences cell differentiation at the plant shoot apex
article.abstract: The balance between proliferation and differentiation in the plant shoot apical meristem is controlled by regulatory loops involving the phytohormone cytokinin and stem cell identity genes.

sections.introduction: The development of land plants provides a unique opportunity to study how cell differentiation is determined, as plant cell identity is highly plastic.
sections.methods: Plants were grown on full-strength Murashige and Skoog (MS) medium (pH 5.7; Caisson Labs) with 0.8% (w/v) agar (Caisson Labs).
sections.results: When grown on solid medium for over 14â€…days, msl2 msl3 double mutant plants developed a proliferating mass of undifferentiated cells, or callus, at the apex of the plant.
sections.discussion: One of the most fundamental decisions a cell can make is whether to proliferate or to differentiate.

article.insights_summary: Plastid osmotic stress influences cell differentiation at the plant shoot apex by activating the cytokinin/WUS feedback loop.
